snippet: Michael Shear, Times political reporter and chief correspondent for The Caucus, has been on the ground in Iowa all week, following the candidates, watching the polls and talking to voters. He hosted a Facebook chat on Tuesday afternoon.
abstract: Michael Shear, Times political reporter and chief correspondent for The Caucus, has been on the ground in Iowa all week, following the candidates, watching the polls and talking to voters. He hosted a Facebook chat on Tuesday afternoon.
lead_paragraph: Updated | 4:12 p.m. As Iowans and voters around the country awaited the beginning of the 2012 Republican nomination contests on Tuesday night, Michael Shear, a Times political reporter and chief correspondent for The Caucus blog, hosted a live -- and lively -- discussion about the caucuses on The Times's Facebook page. Below, a transcript of highlights from the chat.
